column4: Okay, I need some help getting my sound working... XMMS when it plays mp3s just blazes through them (no, not using the DiskWriter plugin) and there aren't any system events at all, including login stuff.
could you paste the output of "lsmod | grep snd" to www.pastebin.com ?
what kind of machine is it?
i386.  Or do you want the detailed specs?
I mean, is it a laptop, or a desktop, etc.
desktop
it has a webcam with a microphone via USB plugged in.
but sound has been working before.
what if you reboot with the webcam unplugged, and only plug it in after booting?
let me try that.  brb.
that worked, thanks.  Strange that it was working before.
it has to do with the order of detection.. for some reason USB audio (from the webcam) is detected _before_ the audio on your mainboard
Okay.
I don't reboot that often, nor do I use the webcam that often.  So, it's not a big deal.
XMMS should be in its default settings..
uh, to annoy you? :P
well, of course!  Hehe.
try beep-media-player, it's a GTK2 version of xmms
basically
beep works.
by uninstalling, removing the .xmms directory from ~/, and reinstalling xmms it now plays perfectly.
ok.. well, good luck then
NEVER chmod 777!
really.. it lets other people write
